borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <div><span arial="" style="font-size: 11pt;">T<span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif">he proposed development, specifically the proposed two storey side extension that&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;">presents a discordant,&nbsp;unbalanced and top heavy feature,<span arial=""> fails to respect the character and appearance of the&nbsp;</span>house, built form of the terrace and character of the wider area.</span>&nbsp;As such, the proposed development is contrary to:<br></div><div><br></div><div>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</div><div>- Policy D4 of the London Plan Intended to Publish (March 2021);</div><div>- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</div><div>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</div><div>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);</div><div>- Policies SP4, DM11 and DM16 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 18 Consultation version, November 2019).</div>
description:
Conversion of
existing garage into a habitable space including stepping the front back 2m to
allow for one car parking space, the construction of a two storey side
extension to the extent of the boundary and the construction of a single storey
rear extension
